alert.note: Alert for Central Panhandle Mountains; Northern Panhandle (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 10 at 3:45PM MDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Boundary, central Bonner, and northwestern Shoshone Counties through 330 PM PDT... At 243 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Nordman to near Clark Fork to 8 miles southwest of Osburn. Movement was northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Sandpoint, Bonners Ferry, Kellogg, Osburn, Wallace, Ponderay, Moyie Springs, Kootenai, Smelterville, Clark Fork, East Hope, Wardner, Copeland, Nordman, Hope, Jordan Creek Campground, Schweitzer Mountain, Beaver Creek Campground, Murray, and Prichard. This includes the following highways... Interstate 90 in Idaho between mile markers 48 and 63. U.S. Highway 95 in Idaho between mile markers 473 and 538. U.S. Highway 2 in Idaho between mile markers 28 and 80. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
